file_content.text: All right, all right. You must be the luckiest being in the galaxy.
But Darth Baras will see that luck run out.
Vengeance is served.
We're done. [Kill him]
You're beaten, Draahg. Just give up--you don't have to die.
Surrender and live.
I will not be pitied!
If I had a credit for every time someone I'm about to kill predicted my doom....
Heard that before. [Kill him]
Agh!
He'll burn to death down there. No less than he deserves.
We all deserve mercy, Captain.
Don't be harsh.
If you say so, my lord.
He's burning to death. That's gotta hurt.
Savor that, master. His flesh will burn off, as he suffers the most painful of deaths. Delicious.
Poor creature. Of all the ways to die, I think burning to death is the worst.
He'll burn to a crisp down there. Heh. I could shoot him and put him out of his misery. But why?
We thrill as the Sith betrayer burns in pain! Your clan will be cleansed by fire!
The more painful his death, the better.
I spit on him.
Very satisfying.
Yah, if you say so.
Your spite gives me shivers.
You confuse me, master. What could his suffering possibly accomplish?
Sith sense these moments. The more Draahg suffers, the more unbalanced our enemy may become. And we must seize any advantage.
A warning to Baras.
A necessary evil, then. I think I understand.
We should rejoice whenever pure evil is dispatched.
It's okay to celebrate.
Oh, I see. You leave me with much to think about.
The fight took something out of me, and I said that in weakness.
You're right, Jaesa.
Understandable. Your strength will return to you.
Like your style, my lord.
Yes! Our enemy twists in horror.
No one deserves such a fate.
A shame.
No one deserves to smell such a smell.
Let's get out of here. I'll revive the others and pack them into the ship.
I've never disagreed more with anything you've said.
Spectacle's over. We have more victims to hunt down. I'll revive the others, master.
So true.
I'll make sure everyone is alright and ready to go, master.
No worse than what he would have dealt you, I'm sure.
I'll make sure the others are patched and ready for flight.
Betrayers always die twisting.
We revive the others now. Prepare for more!
My lord, Draahg caught us all by surprise. I take full responsibility for the defeat.
Just revive the others and patch them up.
Tend to the wounded.
Sure thing. Anything to get away from the burning flesh smell.
I suppose I've savored his death long enough.
Of course, master. I'll make sure they're all ready for flight.
I'm on it.
We obey.
Yes, my lord. I'll make sure they're healed and ready for flight.
Draahg was a powerful Sith. You have nothing to be ashamed of.
No harm, Quinn.
Thank you, my lord. But I swear it won't happen again.
When I saw you lying there, I thought the worst. I'm just glad you're still with me.
Don't be silly, Quinn.
It would take much more than Lord Draahg to take me from you.
Your leadership skills are waning, Captain. Perhaps I should place Lieutenant Pierce in charge of things around here.
Inexcusable.
I will not fail you again, my lord.
I'll revive the wounded and have them ready for flight, my lord.
Persistent. It's time I stop prolonging this.
Aw, you think you're doing well.
Sorry to burst your bubble, but I have a secret. I can't be killed.
Permit me to test that statement.
We'll see about that. [Attack]
Are you trying to tell me you're immortal?
Is that so?
I've been gutted, bled dry, jettisoned into space. I survived and grew stronger.
Hurt me. I welcome it.
I'll tear that lie from your throat!
That's idiotic! [Attack]
You will learn the hard way.
You're looking well for someone I blew up.
Your slaves put up a decent fight, too. Darth Baras and I will put them to good use.
Baras is the true Voice of the Emperor, you know. Soon he'll claim his rightful title.
Vengeance will be mine, Draahg. First you, then Baras.
My revenge starts now.
Charming.
I now work for the Emperor's Hand.
I know otherwise.
And Baras is in direct defiance of the Emperor's will.
Lies will not save you, friend.
I'm sorry, if we met before, you failed to make an impression.
And you are?
Then let me jog your memory. Because I want you to know who it is that kills you.
The name will burn in your head--Lord Draahg. Darth Baras's one true apprentice.
Baras held back when training you, but he taught me everything. And Darth Vengean showed me dark side secrets even Baras doesn't know.
I seem to recall that I saved you from Darth Vengean and then killed him.
Vengean was nothing.
Baras told me to hold back. To keep the extent of my power secret from Vengean and you.
Alone, Vengean would have wiped the floor with you. That's why I was there in the first place.
You're deluding yourself. There's nothing I don't know.
My training was complete.
Baras thinks years ahead, friend. He knew before he even took you on that you would be his patsy.
I, on the other hand, have been groomed to be his general from the start.
To make sure you stay dead this time, I'm taking your head.
Get to it, then!
Let's do this! [Attack]
I'm warning you, leave now or your life ends in regret.
Back down or die.
My head has a strict "no detachment" policy.
Sorry, still using it.
Humor is often used to mask fear.
Time to finish what I started.
Show me what you got, Draahg!
Let's see. [Attack]
I'm ready for you!
And I've met the true Voice.
No harm, Quinn.
